did.unittitle: "Charcoals of new and old New York" drafts and limited edition published version
did.abstract:
The collection includes three documents: 1) a published version of F. Hopkinson Smith's "Charcoals of New and Old New York," signed by Smith and printed on Van Gelder handmade paper, number 59(?) of 125; 2) an annotated and edited typescript draft of Charcoals; and 3) a draft manuscript with both typed and autograph (holographic) pages. The draft has multiple versions of at least some of the chapters. Chapters include: I. Wall Street; II. The Skyscraper; III. The Brooklyn Bridge; IV. The City Hall; V. Castle Garden; VI. Behind Shinbone Alley; VII. Elizabeth Street; VIII. Clinton Court; IX. No. 5 West Twenty-eighth Street; X. The Little Church Around the Corner; XI. The Grand Canon of the Yellow; XII. The Stock Exchange; XIII. The Upheaval [construction site]; XIV. The Subway--Bridge Station; XV. Manhattan; XVI. Madison Square; XVII Gansevoort Market; XVIII. Edgar Allan Poe's House at Fordham; XIX. Jumel Mansion; XX. The Bronx; XXI. The Willows.
